meanings.definition: The maintenance or support of something.
meanings.sent1: Regular upkeeps of the playground equipment ensure its longevity.
meanings.sent2: The upkeeps of the garden involve watering and weeding regularly.
meanings.sent3: The upkeeps of the old car became a family joke as it seemed to need fixing every week.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the upkeeps of the community center was like a guardian watching over it.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous upkeeps of the historic building preserved its beauty for generations to come.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping something in good condition.
meanings.sent1: His diligent upkeeps of the antique clock kept it ticking smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Regular upkeeps of the computer system prevent breakdowns.
meanings.sent3: The upkeeps of her favorite dress involved careful washing and ironing.
meanings.sent4: The upkeeps of the garden shed were like a ritual to maintain its appearance.
meanings.sent5: The upkeeps of the sports equipment ensure they last through many games.

meanings.definition: The cost or expense of maintaining something.
meanings.sent1: The monthly upkeeps of the car included fuel and maintenance costs.
meanings.sent2: The upkeeps of the house were higher than expected due to repairs.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected upkeeps of the boat drained his savings account.
meanings.sent4: The upkeeps of the business were carefully budgeted to avoid financial strain.
meanings.sent5: The upkeeps of the road infrastructure are necessary for safe travel.
